We don't assign issues. Other contributors will know it's been solved when the issue is closed :)

content.body: Domenic: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1475907#c4 - is this right? The navigation event deliberately doesn't fire when traversing to a bfcache'd page?
content.formatted_body: Domenic: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1475907#c4 - is this right? The navigation event deliberately doesn't fire when traversing to a bfcache'd page?

content.body: * Domenic: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1475907#c4 - is this right? The `navigate` event deliberately doesn't fire when traversing to a bfcache'd page?
content.formatted_body: * Domenic: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1475907#c4 - is this right? The navigate event deliberately doesn't fire when traversing to a bfcache'd page?

m.new_content.body: Domenic: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1475907#c4 - is this right? The `navigate` event deliberately doesn't fire when traversing to a bfcache'd page?
m.new_content.formatted_body: Domenic: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1475907#c4 - is this right? The navigate event deliberately doesn't fire when traversing to a bfcache'd page?

content.body: No, seems like a bug. There's nothing in the spec that looks at the destination's bfcache status.

Hi folks. [WebDriver BiDi would like to hook in to "run the animation frame callbacks."](https://w3c.github.io/webdriver-bidi/#issue-b2b83ca0) I'm thinking HTML could define a general-purpose extension point for that situation (maybe with a queue of tasks into which a spec like BiDi could push), it it could explicitly invoke an algorithm provided by BiDi. Is there a preference between these two? Or a more appropriate approach that I haven't considered?
content.formatted_body: Hi folks. WebDriver BiDi would like to hook in to "run the animation frame callbacks." I'm thinking HTML could define a general-purpose extension point for that situation (maybe with a queue of tasks into which a spec like BiDi could push), it it could explicitly invoke an algorithm provided by BiDi. Is there a preference between these two? Or a more appropriate approach that I haven't considered?

content.body: [Looks like "Update the rendering" has already been extended with steps to inform other specs of this event](https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/webappapis.html#update-the-rendering)
content.formatted_body: Looks like "Update the rendering" has already been extended with steps to inform other specs of this event
